WRITING.TITLE: Finally
WRITING.TEXT: I went to the hospital after I tried to cut my wrists. I missed my veins several times and eventually gave up. I was walking around with a cut up arm and tried to end my own life; this is when I realized something was wrong and I need help. Upon hindsight, I was extremely naive to do this but I showed my arm to my school councilor. He was the only one at school I trusted with this type of information. Like anyone else in his position would have done, he followed protocol and called the ambulance. I was taken to the hospital and to the #8220;psych-ward #8221; part of the hospital. I think it was there when I was diagnosed. Ever since I have been seeing my therapist regularly. For a while after seeing my therapist, I was starting to question if the constant self harm, self-loathing and unhappiness was a result of some type of chemical imbalance (something that I #8217;m not controlling/can #8217;t control). I wondered if this was the case because all the conversations I have had with her and my amazing parents were and still are never enough to keep me from walking around either mad at myself, or randomly sad and empty. Being unhappy, negative and hurting myself has been natural to me since at least 5th grade (I #8217;m going to college now). I recently asked my therapist what I was diagnosed with in an effort to prove to myself if my actions and mood are a result of what my brain does on its own or not. Turns out I have major depressive disorder (clinical depression). Everything finally makes sense now and it kind of takes a weight of my chest; for so long, I #8217;ve been asking myself #8220;what #8217;s wrong with you? #8221; But now I know and it makes even more sense as to why I #8217;m so attracted to negativity and why I take SO much comfort in my suffering. I #8217;m honestly just glad that I finally have an answer. That doesn #8217;t mean my problems are going anywhere but I at least know what #8217;s going on. I might get medicated and treat it like I do with my ADHD but I will think more about it before I make a decision.
